subject: Re: [junit] junit4: Exceptions in TestListener
msgSnippet: Elliotte, What would you expect the test runner to do if it caught one of these exceptions?  In general, I would expect that listeners should not interrupt the
messageBody:
Elliotte,

What would you expect the test runner to do if it caught one of these
exceptions? In general, I would expect that listeners should not
interrupt the test execution: if they find themselves unable to do what
they want, they should quietly deal with it on their own.

David Saff

Elliotte Rusty Harold wrote:

> I'm trying to implement a custom TestListener in JUnit 4. These methods
> do I/O. They tend to look like this:
>
> public void testRunStarted(int testCount) {
> try {
> out.write("<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?>\r\n");
> }
> catch (IOException ex) {
> throw new RuntimeException(ex);
> }
> }
>
> Should the TestListener interfaces be declared to throw Exception or
> some kind of JUnitException so one doesn't have to wrap everything in a
> RuntimeException?
>
>
